website_summaries.verdict: The latest-gen Raspberry Pi in a smaller, cheaper form, the Pi 3 Model A+ is a no-brainer for Pi enthusiasts, even though it lacks the increased memory and port selection of the larger Model B+.
pros: Tiny and inexpensive for experimental implementations
cons: Half the memory of the Model B+

customer_reviews.title: As long as you only need a single USB and WiFi only, this is great
customer_reviews.text: This is at a crazy low price, so as an item I wanted to try out as cheap as possible, it was perfect. But be aware, compared to the B+ model, it has half the RAM, a quarter of the USB ports, and no ethernet. I'm using it to connect to my 3D printer via USB and to the network by Wireless, and it is great. Octoprint worked great on it, but I found an annoying bug in the image, so installed Repetier-Server instead, which works, but pushes the 512mb RAM to the limit, so may require occasional rebooting.
customer_reviews.author: S. Patel

customer_reviews.title: Octoprint
customer_reviews.text: Working beautifully with octopi (octoprint), I added a cheap case I also got from Amazon and fitted a small fan to the top, I also added a USB hub to give me the extra port I needed for a WebCam, I used a MP1584 to drop the 12v from the printers power supply to 5v that the PI needs,. Check out the photo I added of the resource manager while printing to see The resources used and how much headroom you have.
customer_reviews.author: ray

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and powerful
customer_reviews.text: Versatile piece of kit for anyone exploring electronics and coding. Lots of starter kits available. I have used my latest purchase as a kids jukebox to play music when an rfid card is scanned using an rfid module I bought separately. Be aware that it doesn’t have the same amount of RAM and ports as the B+, so check your requirements carefully. I use a usb hub when not using headless. Wouldn’t recommend as an everyday computer. Browsing is a little slow but great for fun projects.
customer_reviews.author: JonnyW

customer_reviews.title: Nice little Raspberry Pi
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as the basis for a smart mirror I am building...It's size made it perfect for what I wanted.. I do find these a little pricier than some other places but the quick delivery was what persuaded me.. You do need to know what you are doing with these little computers but it's not difficult to learn. It's a cracking little unit, would have got 5*s if the price had been that little bit lower...
customer_reviews.author: Garry Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Mid-range computer excellent value for money
customer_reviews.text: I was so amazed at the price of this which is less powerful than the 4B+ but still is fantastic for project work. It was little more than the cost of the Zero WH but has the much better processor. I've recommended this to everyone since
customer_reviews.author: Mr. J. W. A. Thomson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent minicomputer, great value.
customer_reviews.text: I've used first gen pi's for projects since they first arrived. I wanted a media centre for the lounge and built one with an old model b+ but Kodi was a bit jerky. I then saw the 3 a pi at £22 and £3.19 for the case. I now have an excellent media centre.
customer_reviews.author: Mick Barker

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive way to start tinkering
customer_reviews.text: Fab little computer board, easy to use. I have put octiprint with 5mp camera on it. Easy to set up remote control on windows with vnc viewer and control it from there. It's not the most powerful of them all but good for the job!
customer_reviews.author: Anax

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says, beware the lack of USB ports
customer_reviews.text: Does what it says on the tin, but I have come to find the single USB port annoying. Ended up having to buy a hub to plug in a mouse and keyboard at the same time. Would probably consider a B next time.
customer_reviews.author: ezequiel85

customer_reviews.title: A+ cases fit it
customer_reviews.text: An incredible upgrade to my Pi A+. Quad Core instead of single core Twice the ram 5ghz wireless included Bluetooth included My a+ Is now my pi-hole as look at turning this into a retropie or kodi box
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: works great for octoprint
customer_reviews.text: hooked up to my 3d printer with octoprint setup and a raspberry pi camera module. its a solid piece of hardware for cheap and i can see my prints at work and pause them if needed because my wife doesnt know how to pause it haha.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Powerful little mite
customer_reviews.text: Got mine running motion eye OS with 5 rtsp streams attached, takes some tweaking motion eye but once set this thing just does it's job. Spot on
customer_reviews.author: P Barber

customer_reviews.title: Music Player and Streamer for less than £20
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for when an ethernet connection is not required as it has easily configurable WiFi. Along with a good, speedy, CPU and enough RAM to run Volumio with gusto.
customer_reviews.author: I do my best

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to add to my MotionEyeOs setup, work perfectly despite not having an ethernet port to configure the MEOS setup.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Spicyweiner

customer_reviews.title: Excellent piece of kit
customer_reviews.text: Good value and an amazing improvement on the original Pi that this was bought to replace
customer_reviews.author: 900Sport

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: Amazing little computer! Does the job very well. High performance is such a small unit!
customer_reviews.author: Alexandru-Marian

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: One of the best raspberry pis available. Best bang for buck.
customer_reviews.author: UKRifter

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this!! We’ve got games from all years on it. Amazing!!
customer_reviews.author: Chantelle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little device
customer_reviews.text: Excellent little device. Easy to use. Useful in place of the full size model.
customer_reviews.author: peter

customer_reviews.title: Cheapest linux PC.
customer_reviews.text: I love it, so cheap and so good. Very good for pentesting.
customer_reviews.author: Evaldas

customer_reviews.title: It is completely compatible with the "standard" Rpi 3 but for much less money
customer_reviews.text: Excellent as an imbedded processor with audio and HD video capability plus the very useful gpio connection. I used it to make a miniature push-button video player for digital signage applications.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Clynick

customer_reviews.title: It has very low ram and memory.
customer_reviews.text: With the 512mb model you can't even type on google with out it having to reboot. Everything else is fine. I hope this is fixed with this model.
customer_reviews.author: J Mason

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Very tiny, yet very powerful device. And best of all, comes with very little cost in comparison with the B+ version.
customer_reviews.author: Fady Anwar

customer_reviews.title: Second one
customer_reviews.text: I use it as a media player in my van running off a small solar panel. Unfortunately my first one stopped working so got another one. Probably my fault 🤔
customer_reviews.author: David Murray

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: Very happy... It's this what I looking for... For that money cannot expect nothing Better
customer_reviews.author: Mario

customer_reviews.title: Great Pi
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a small project does the job perfect, very good entry level Pi.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jasper

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great product, easy to use, super fast next day delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Jewels

customer_reviews.title: Greatr product
customer_reviews.text: Graet little Pi. Bought to build a retropie. Wanted the quad core processor but in a smaller form factor ad the zero was just a little slow.
customer_reviews.author: andrew langdale
